basics.name: Rachel R. Langgin
basics.label: Second-year Astronomy PhD Student
basics.summary: Graduate Astronomy Student at the University of Nevada-Las Vegas, Research Assistant with the LIGO Scientific Collaboration, NV NASA Graduate Research Fellow (2024-2025)

education.thesis: Spectral Analysis of Red and Blue Quasars and their Effect on Galactic Evolution

education.institution: Las Vegas Academy of the Arts

research.name: LIGO Scientific Collaboration
research.location: University of Nevada-Las Vegas, Las Vegas, NV, USA
research.summary: Graduate astronomy student researcher studying compact object binaries through gravitational-wave analysis with the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory (LIGO) Scientific Collaboration (LSC), advised by Dr. Carl-Johan Haster.

research.name: Glikman Lab (Remote) & Masters Galaxy Group
research.summary: Conducted my undergraduate senior thesis using a radio, infrared, and optically selected sample of blue quasars to put dust-reddened red quasars in context. We found a radio-selection dependency and the fraction of red quasars to be 32% in order to complete the UKFS and W2M surveys; advised by Dr. Eilat Glikman & Dr. Karen Masters.

research.name: Glikman Lab
research.position: Keck Northeast Astronomy Consortium Research Scholar
research.summary: Studied a candidate dual quasar system using Hubble Space Telescope data and completed a spectroscopic analysis of the closely separated sources with StisTools and found the possible QSO system links dust-reddening to galaxy and black hole mergers; advised by Dr. Eilat Glikman

research.name: Masters Galaxy Group
research.summary: Researched various intrinsic parameters of galactic bars using SDSS MaNGA data, including bar length and position angle, to complete a population comparison analysis, and participated in weekly group journal presentations; advised by Dr. Karen Masters

research.name: Masters Galaxy Group
research.position: Marian E. Koshland Integrated Natural Science Center Summer Researcher & Fellow
research.summary: Investigated galaxy kinematics and bar formation, performed elliptical isophote analysis with Photutils on MaNGA galaxies. Participated in HI data reduction, GalaxyZoo classifications, radon transform classifications, daily team collaborations, and weekly journal clubs.

research.name: Bryn Mawr Plasma Laboratory
research.location: Bryn Mawr College, Bryn Mawr, PA, USA (Remote)
research.summary: Curated interactive Jupyter notebooks to cover college-level physics concepts and lessons focused on electromagnetism; advised and funded by Dr. David Schaffner.

outreach.name: Las Vegas Astronomical Society
outreach.summary: Invited speaker for the Las Vegas Astronomical Society chapter public educational Star Parties and meeting speaker operating under the College of Southern Nevada Planetarium, Dr. Andrew Kerr, Director.

outreach.name: Astronomy on Tap
outreach.location: Astronomy Aleworks, Las Vegas, NV, USA
outreach.summary: Co-organizer with colleagues at the Nevada Center for Astrophysics to share the excitement of astronomy and astrophysics with the general public and local community.

outreach.name: Science Fair Judge
outreach.location: Canyon Springs Highschool, Las Vegas, NV, USA
outreach.summary: Led the adjudication of annual science fairs for middle and high school students, evaluating projects for creativity, scientific rigor, and presentation skills.

outreach.name: Strawbridge Observatory
outreach.summary: Operated 12 and 16 inch telescopes to explain astrophysical concepts to students and community members while navigating the night sky through the constellations.

outreach.name: Mittleman Observatory
outreach.summary: Operated 8 and 11 inch telescopes to explain basic astronomical phenomena in both English and Spanish for Middlebury Language School students and community members while promoting dark skies.

awards.title: NASA Graduate Research Opportunity Fellow
awards.summary: Utilizing early-warning gravitational wave signals preceding binary neutron star mergers to refine source location and observe electromagnetic counterparts in collaboration with Dr. Brad Cenko, Principal Investigator of the Neil Gehrels Swift Observatory.

certificates.name: Machine Learning and AI in Time-Domain Astronomy
